Selected Answer: BCD
C. when a record is created
D. when a record is updated
B. when a record is deleted

These three types of events (C, D, B) can generate a trigger for tasks in Power Automate because they are actions that can occur within the common data model and can initiate a workflow. For example, when a new record is created, a workflow could be triggered to perform data validation or send a notification. When a record is updated, a workflow could be triggered to update related records or perform calculations. And when a record is deleted, a workflow could be triggered to archive or delete related records.
A and E events are not possible triggers as they only represent a read operation which typically do not require any automated task to be performed.

discussion.content:
Correct answers.

1. Restricting the permissions of Dataverse users is done on Environment Level.
2. Preventing users to connect to data sources is done by creating DLP policies, which also uses Tenant Level Security.

You can create data loss prevention (DLP) policies that can act as guardrails to help prevent users from unintentionally exposing organizational data. DLP policies can be scoped at the environment level or tenant level, offering flexibility to craft sensible policies that strike the right balance between protection and productivity. For tenant-level policies you can define the scope to be all environments, selected environments, or all environments except ones you specifically exclude. Environment-level policies can be defined for one environment at a time.

https://learn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/power-platform/admin/prevent-data-loss

C. Environment-level policies: This enables you to control data access and actions within each environment independently. By configuring environment-level policies, you can ensure that customer data is not shared improperly and that users can only connect to data sources with the appropriate permissions within specific environments.

D. Tenant-level policies: They can be useful for general governance and security settings.
